Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with part of griffin's head in added white and tongue and throat in added red, to left; below, white band above square and billet pattern in red and white; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 119, p. 285, no. 813, pl. 114)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. IX, no. 3)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 33, no. 7, pl. XVII)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 69, p. 140, no. 783)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0851) (phase 2)
